entry.title: How to change a git commit message safely
entry.content:
Introduction:

In Git, may be sometimes when we might want to change a commit message, whether it's to correct a typo or provide a more meaningful description or simply fix something we missed. Fortunately, git provides powerful tools to help with this.

 

Changing a commit message depends on the context:

  1. When the commit is the most recent
  2. When the commit is older
  3. When you want to keep the same message but add more changes to the commit

 

1. Change the Most Recent Commit Message:

If you just committed and haven‚Äôt pushed yet: git commit --amend -m "New commit message"

git commit --amend -m "New commit message"
  • This updates the last commit message.
  • Alternatively, If you omit the -m flag, git will open your default editor so you can edit the message there.

 Screenshot: 1.1

 

2. Change an Older Commit Message

To change a commit message further back in history, use interactive rebase: git rebase -i HEAD~n

git rebase -i HEAD~1
  • Replace n with the number of commits you want to go back (e.g., HEAD~1)
  • In the editor that appears, change pick to reword for the commit(s) whose message you want to update
  • git will then prompt you to enter a new message for each selected commit, modify it and save it (Refer screenshot 2.2 & 2.3)

 Screenshot: 2.1

 Screenshot: 2.2

  Screenshot: 2.3

 

3. Most Recent Commit Without Changing Its Message

To update the files or staging of your last commit while keeping the original message: git commit --amend --no-edit

git commit --amend --no-edit
  • This preserves the previous commit message, but lets you include new changes (e.g., add forgotten files - means stage the files, then run the above comment)
  • Useful when you've made minor updates and don't want to touch the commit message

 Screenshot 3.1

Please Note:

  • Use --force only if you're sure ‚Äî this can impact collaborators on the branch.
  • If you‚Äôve already pushed, changing commit messages rewrites history: git push --force
git push --force

Understanding how to change Git commit messages is essential for good version control, always use these commands carefully, especially on shared branches and communicate with your team before rewriting history.

Thank you for taking the time to read this blog! I hope this helps you improve your commit messages. If you found this helpful, please feel free to share your thoughts, feedback, or questions in the comments. Let's keep learning and growing together!

Stay tuned for more Git-related commands in future blogs. Happy coding!

Dear experts, I‚Äôm new to blogging, please feel free to correct me if any information is inaccurate.

entry.title: Re: Payment method query with CDS view in the workforce p...
entry.content:
Thank you for your question.

Have a look at CDS Views for Human Resources, WorkAgreementPaymentInformationDetails & Manage Workforce links for more details.

Below i have listed the available CDS views:

  1. I_WorkforcePersonDEX_1: Provides an overview of workforce personnel, integrating business partner data and identification details.
  2. I_WorkforcePerson: Offers basic details about workforce persons, including internal employees and contingent workers.
  3. I_WorkforcePersonSkillTag: Retrieves skill tag details related to workforce personnel based on External Person ID.
  4. I_WorkforcePersonSkillTagDEX: Provides a comprehensive overview of skill tags associated with workforce personnel, including insights into skills and competencies. These views facilitate data extraction and support various business questions related to workforce management.

To summarise, you can query payment methods for a workforce person‚Äôs work Agreement using the released CDS views.

  • You can make use of I_WorkAgreementPaymentMethod to retrieve the payment method you assigned for a work agreement.
  • Thereafter, you should join it with I_WorkforcePersonWorkAgreement to link it back to the Workforce Person.

After joining, it will return Person --> Work Agreement --> Payment Method and Bank Account if it is applicable.

You can also view the same data manually in the Manage Workforce and Manage Work Agreement Fiori apps.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Passing a range in open sql select join conditions
entry.content:
Again, the SELECT you show will be equivalent to the same SELECT without LEFT OUTER JOIN because you don't extract any column from ZTABLE.

In ABAP 7.50, not a lot of solutions.

First solution: take the range selection out of the LEFT JOIN and filter the internal table after SELECT.

Second solution, based on the fact that WHERE IS NULL on a left-joined table column means that there's no line found in table:

 

DATA range_currency TYPE RANGE OF sflight-currency.
range_currency = VALUE #( ( sign = 'I' option = 'EQ' low = 'USD' ) ).
SELECT
  FROM scarr
       LEFT JOIN sflight
         ON  sflight~carrid    = scarr~carrid
         AND sflight~currency <> 'EUR'
  FIELDS scarr~carrid,
         sflight~connid,
         sflight~currency
  WHERE sflight~currency     IS NULL
     OR sflight~currency NOT IN @range_currency
  INTO TABLE @DATA(itab).

 

Third solution, by building the from/join dynamically with rzzumskz <> value1 AND rzzumskz <> value2 ... instead of your ranges table (range_umskz), assuming that it's composed of lines I EQ value1 ...:

 

TYPES: BEGIN OF itab_line,
         carrid   TYPE scarr-carrid,
         connid   TYPE sflight-connid,
         currency TYPE sflight-currency,
       END OF itab_line.
DATA itab TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF itab_line.
DATA range_currency TYPE RANGE OF sflight-currency.
range_currency = VALUE #( ( sign = 'I' option = 'EQ' low = 'USD' ) ).
DATA(dynamic_from) = ` scarr`
                  && ` LEFT JOIN sflight`
                  && `   ON  sflight~carrid    = scarr~carrid`
                  && `   AND sflight~currency <> 'EUR'`.
LOOP AT range_currency ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<line_range_currency>)
        WHERE     sign   = 'I'
              AND option = 'EQ'.
  dynamic_from = dynamic_from && | AND sflight~currency <> '{ <line_range_currency>-low }'|.
ENDLOOP.
SELECT scarr~carrid,
       sflight~connid,
       sflight~currency
  FROM (dynamic_from)
  INTO TABLE @itab.

entry.title: Re: Notification in SVT when registration data is not mai...
entry.content:
Hello

check e.g. https://community.sap.com/t5/product-lifecycle-management-blog-posts-by-members/substance-volume-tracking-using-sap-ehs-management/ba-p/13272665

The scenario ou would like to supoprt is absolut SAP standard. If you just do the configuration accordingly: an eMail will be spread / generated

On top: you can decide to block the process or at least to get a "pop up" explaining that there is a problem

The most high level important piece is: the master data must be "perfect" (on very high level) to use SVT

Companies are underestimating the effort to maintain the data. 

a.) you need to define: which material is relevant?

b.) you need to define on REAL_SUB level a composition

Experience is showing: here a lot of data gaps are coming up. UNder such conditions: it does not make sense to sent a Mail or block the process or...

The EHS SVT must be understand on daily basis. Huge effort come up to define what material is relevant aand to define a compositon

So please consider data quality first

C.B.

entry.title: Re: SAC - List of all classic stories / List of all classic apps
entry.content: Maybe a first step can be the rendering of a full listing via SAC API. There you at least the overview and have the access URL to each story. From there you can then take it further. Here is how you can easily create that list: Step 1: Generate a full inventory listing as JSON file via Endpoint: https://[your-tenant].sapanalytics.cloud/api/v1/stories and save the JSON results in file. Output: Complete JSON inventory Step 2: Convert to CSV via jq (terminal) for analysis and further processing bash: cat mySACstories.json | jq -r '.[] | [.name, .isTemplate, .isSample, .created, .createdBy, .OpenURL] | @CsV' > mySACstories.csv

entry.title: VIM Foundation & Invoice Solution Configuration Overview
entry.content:
Introduction

Vendor Invoice Management (VIM) is a third-party OpenText solution that serves as an alternative to the SAP AP transaction MIRO and integrates seamlessly with SAP S/4HANA. If you‚Äôve ever wondered where to start with VIM, which configurations are required first, or what the technical foundation framework looks like, this guide is for you.

In this article, I‚Äôll walk you through key VIM concepts and transactions, provide a high-level technical and functional summary, and share example steps to configure a complete VIM process.

Please fee free to reach out to me if you have any detailed VIM question: yonglin.chen@sap.com

Agenda

    1. Useful VIM Introductory Links
    2. Difference Between VIM Foundation & VIM Invoice Solution
    3. VIM Business Process ‚Äì Overview
    4. Practical Sequences & Configuration Recommendations
    5. Example Scenario of PO- vs Non-PO Invoice Flow
    6. Signavio Process Flow of VIM Inbound Channel

 

 

1, Useful VIM link

To begin with, below are some useful links to introduce the solution:

SAP Product Introduction: SAP Invoice Management by OpenText | Invoice Management

OpenText Product Introduction: SAP Invoice Processing | OpenText

 

If you have access as an OpenText partner user:

OpenText VIM for SAP Version 23.4 Configuration Guide for Foundation: OpenText‚Ñ¢ Vendor Invoice Management for SAP¬Æ Solutions: Configuration Guide for Foundation (VIMZ230400-CGF-EN-04)

OpenText VIM for SAP Version 23.4 Configuration Guide for Invoice Solution: OpenText‚Ñ¢ Vendor Invoice Management for SAP¬Æ Solutions: Configuration Guide for Invoice Solution (VIMZ230400-CGD-EN-03)

 

2, Difference between VIM Foundation & VIM Invoice Solutions

 

You might be wondering about the difference between the VIM Configuration Guide for Foundation and Invoice Solution.

Foundation:
Focuses on the technical backbone supporting all VIM processes, including logical systems, API configurations, BAdIs for document classification, and other infrastructure. The primary configuration transaction is /OTX/PF00_IMG.

Invoice Solution:
Focuses on invoice-specific business process configurations, including PO vs. non-PO flows, approvals, workflow routing, financial checks, Fiori apps, and integration with other SAP/OpenText modules. The primary configuration transaction is /OPT/SPRO.

Figure 1: transaction /OTX/PF00_IMG

Figure 2: transaction /OPT/SPRO

 

 

High-level summary

/OTX/PF00_IMG (OpenText VIM Foundation) ‚Äî the technical backbone. Configure system-level services, APIs, inbound channels, profiles, work object types, logging, caching, and other infrastructure pieces that make VIM operable across environments.

/OPT/SPRO (OpenText VIM Invoice Solution) ‚Äî the business/process layer. Configure invoice-specific rules: document processing, PO/non-PO flows, approval workflows, financial posting rules, Fiori UI behavior, and cross-component behaviors.

Think of it as: Foundation = make the platform work; Solution = make the business process run.

 

3, VIM Business Process - Overview

Before we deep dive in the detailed important configuration concepts, I would like to show you a full picture of VIM business process (in the end, there's a process chart):

1. Ingestion (Receive)

The Vendor Invoice Management (VIM) process begins with the ingestion phase, where invoices are received and uploaded into the system by vendors, suppliers, or the internal receiving team. This can be done through various methods such as email, vendor portals, online submission forms, EDI (Electronic Data Interchange), or physical delivery, triggering the invoice handling workflow.

2. Invoice Recognition

Following the receipt of invoices, the invoice recognition phase employs automated software, including Optical Character Recognition (OCR), AI, and machine learning algorithms, to extract relevant information from the invoices. The aim is to convert the invoice data into a structured format that can be processed and analyzed by the organization's systems, ensuring accurate data extraction and preparation for further processing.

3. Invoice Verification

Once the data has been extracted, the invoice verification phase validates the extracted information against internal records and predefined criteria using ERP systems and Accounts Payable automation software. This often involves 3-way matching, where the invoice is cross-referenced with purchase orders and receiving reports to ensure accuracy, compliance, and legitimacy. This step is crucial for verifying the authenticity and correctness of the invoice data.

4. Exception Handling

If discrepancies or issues are detected during the verification phase, the exception handling phase comes into play. The Accounts Payable team, sometimes involving vendors or internal stakeholders, uses exception handling modules within accounting software and workflow management tools to identify and resolve these issues. This step is crucial for correcting any errors or discrepancies and ensuring smooth processing and compliance.

5. Approval

Finally, the approval phase involves the final review and approval of the invoice by approving authorities such as department heads or managers, based on a predefined approval workflow. This is typically done using approval workflows within ERP systems, e-signature platforms, or automated approval systems, authorizing the payment and ensuring all necessary checks and balances are in place before the invoice proceeds to the payment stage.

 

Figure 3: High-level VIM process

 

4, Practical Sequences & Configuration Recommendations

Below is a recommended sequence to configure a complete VIM process with transactions provided.

(1) Foundation first (/OTX/PF00_IMG)

  • Map logical systems & RFCs, set ArchiveLink repository, configure IES/OCR endpoints, import BC sets for channels and handlers, define work object types.
  • Inbound channels & capture (/OTX/PF00_IMG - Inbound Configuration)
    • Configure channels and test ingestion for all sources (email, SFTP, IES).
    • Tune extraction templates and activate extraction profiles.

(2) Profiles & data model (/OTX/PF00_IMG - Process Configuration)

  • Create recognition/classification profiles and the processing profiles the solution will use.
  • Test sample invoices end-to-end.

 

(3) Solution / Document Processing (/OPT/SPRO - Document Type Configuration & Approval Configuration)

  • Configure document types, mapping IDs, duplicate checks, posting determination, and PO matching rules. (/OPT/SPRO - Document Processing Configuration)
  • Configure Chart-of-Authority and approval workflows.  (/OPT/SPRO - Invoice Approval Configuration)

(4) UI/Fiori & Workplace

  • Configure what users see in the Invoice Detail screen and Fiori tiles, enable OData/web services.
  • Test role/authorization flows.

(5) Integration & final testing

  • End-to-end posting into FI/MM, archiving verification, high-volume testing, performance tuning and logging.

 

5, Example Scenario: PO vs Non-PO Invoice Flow

To give you a taste of real life VIM. There's a scenario: A vendor submits two invoices: one referencing a purchase order (PO) and one without (Non-PO).

VIM Process:

  1. Ingestion: Both invoices are uploaded via email and captured by the inbound channel.
  2. Recognition: OCR extracts the invoice data. The PO number is identified on the first invoice; the second has no PO.
  3. Verification:
    • The PO invoice triggers a three-way match (Invoice ‚Üí PO ‚Üí Goods Receipt).
    • The Non-PO invoice triggers an exception workflow for validation by AP staff.
  4. Approval:
    • The PO invoice may follow automated approval if amounts are below defined thresholds.
    • The Non-PO invoice requires manual approval by the department head.
  5. Posting: Once approved, both invoices are posted to FI/MM and archived.

Purpose:
This scenario demonstrates how VIM differentiates invoice types and routes them through different workflows, helping consultants understand processing, exception handling, and approval logic.

 

6, Signavio Process Flow of VIM Inbound Channel

 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall, the article illustrates how VIM (Vendor Invoice Management) for SAP combines both technical configuration and business process considerations. The Foundation Guide provides the essential platform setup, workflow framework, and global settings that ensure consistency and stability across the system. Building on this, the Invoice Solution Guide focuses on invoice-specific logic, such as document types, exception handling, and posting rules, aligning the technical setup with operational requirements. Together, these layers support end-to-end business processes, enabling efficient, accurate, and compliant invoice handling within the broader organizational workflow.

Hope you enjoy the reading! üôÇ

entry.title: API "Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF" : how to consume in ABAP Cloud ?
entry.content:
Dear All,

Requirement : in S/4HANA Public Cloud, reading Header Texts from a Billing Document, in ABAP Cloud

To fulfill this requirement, the CDS entity "I_BillingDocumentTextTP" cannot be used, as it does not return the LongText.

Therefore, I want to consume the API "API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV" in ABAP Cloud.

I'm following the steps as described in https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/cloud-sdk/ABAP

--> Generating Proxies for Remote OData Service.

I have created a Service Consumption Model :

I have copied the code of the Entity Set A_BillingDocumentText into my class, and I have added the input parameters for the method "cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement"

 

 DATA:
      ls_entity_key    TYPE z_scm_api_billing_document_srv=>tys_a_billing_document_text_ty,
      ls_business_data TYPE z_scm_api_billing_document_srv=>tys_a_billing_document_text_ty,
      lo_http_client   TYPE REF TO if_web_http_client,
      lo_resource      TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_resource_entity,
      lo_client_proxy  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_client_proxy,
      lo_request       TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_request_read,
      lo_response      TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_response_read.

    TRY.
        " Create http client
        TRY.
            DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                         comm_scenario  = 'SAP_COM_0120'
                                                         comm_system_id = 'CPI'
                                                         service_id     = 'BD_CONFIRMATION_OUT_SPRX'
                                                         ).
          CATCH cx_http_dest_provider_error INTO DATA(cx_http_dest_provider_error).
            RAISE SHORTDUMP cx_http_dest_provider_error.
        ENDTRY.

        lo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination( lo_destination ).
        lo_client_proxy = /iwbep/cl_cp_factory_remote=>create_v2_remote_proxy(
          EXPORTING
             is_proxy_model_key       = VALUE #( repository_id       = 'DEFAULT'
                                                 proxy_model_id      = 'Z_SCM_API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV'
                                                 proxy_model_version = '0001' )
            io_http_client             = lo_http_client
            iv_relative_service_root   = '/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/' ).

        ASSERT lo_http_client IS BOUND.


        " Set entity key
        ls_entity_key = VALUE #(
                  billing_document  = '0090000122'
                  language          = 'E'
                  long_text_id      = 'TX06' ).

        " Navigate to the resource
        lo_resource = lo_client_proxy->create_resource_for_entity_set( 'A_BILLING_DOCUMENT_TEXT' )->navigate_with_key( ls_entity_key ).

        " Execute the request and retrieve the business data
        lo_response = lo_resource->create_request_for_read( )->execute( ).
        lo_response->get_business_data( IMPORTING es_business_data = ls_business_data ).

      CATCH /iwbep/cx_cp_remote INTO DATA(lx_remote).
        " Handle remote Exception
        " It contains details about the problems of your http(s) connection

      CATCH /iwbep/cx_gateway INTO DATA(lx_gateway).
        " Handle Exception

      CATCH cx_web_http_client_error INTO DATA(lx_web_http_client_error).
        " Handle Exception
        RAISE SHORTDUMP lx_web_http_client_error.


    ENDTRY.

 

The Communication Arrangement is as follows :

 

When I run the code, an exception is raised by the method cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement: 

Error :
{O:353*\CLASS=CX_HTTP_DEST_PROVIDER_ERROR} Internal error [CM_HTTP_DEST_PROV(004)] CL_HTTP_DESTINATION_PROVIDER [Line:265]

 

The raise location is :

 

What can be the reason for this raised exception ?

 

Many thanks

 

Hans Segers

entry.title: MIME Types truncated in SAP Web Repository (SMW0)
entry.content:
Context: I have some Microsoft Office files, Excel, Word and PowerPoint, already uploaded to the SAP Web Repository (transaction SMW0). My system is ABAP 7.52.

Goal: I want to display these files from SMW0, via the Microsoft Office applications installed on my laptop.

Standard solution and issues:

Their MIME Types must be defined via the menu Settings > Define MIME Types:

Here I can enter the MIME types and corresponding file extensions of Microsoft Office applications.

I repeat the operation 3 times, each time pickup the value for MIME TYPE and EXTENSION:

  • application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet
  • .xlsx
  • application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document
  • .docx
  • application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation
  • .pptx

Now, associate the corresponding programs installed on my laptop via the menu Settings > Assign MIME editor; these settings are user-dependent:

The possible MIME type values are truncated in the screen:

If you choose one of the Office MIME types, its name appears truncated again:

If you don't fix it and save, you get the error "MIME type application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument unknown. Edit the settings":

NB: what's fun is that the setting is saved (but it's useless).

So, the first problem about the truncation is that you have to remember its complete name and type it manually. We'll see below a custom solution to display the full MIME types.

Now, complete the MIME type name, the Excel one for instance:

application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet

In the Editor, you define the path to the program on your laptop, for instance:

C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\root\Office16\EXCEL.EXE

Now, if you select an Excel file (uploading files is simple, so I didn't show how to do it), it downloads the file to a temporary folder on your laptop, Excel opens it:

NB: if you open it in change mode, SMW0 will propose to import the temporary file.

So far, so good.

 

Now comes the second problem about the MIME type truncation (on the screen). If the associated program has been upgraded and is now at a different location, or if you just want to see the MIME type/editor associations, the truncation problem prevents from retrieving and showing the associated program.

So, I have created this little program to display and edit these associations (press F4 to select the MIME type editor; press Save or Execute to save):

Have fun!

For information, in SMW0, the menu Settings > Delete assignments doesn't help, it deletes all the assignments, so it's not very useful:

Code of the program to display and edit the MIME type/editor associations:

REPORT.
TABLES sscrfields.
PARAMETERS dummy.
CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION DEFERRED.
DATA app TYPE REF TO lcl_app.
LOAD-OF-PROGRAM.
  CREATE OBJECT app TYPE ('LCL_APP').
AT SELECTION-SCREEN OUTPUT.
  CALL METHOD app->('PBO').
AT SELECTION-SCREEN.
  CALL METHOD app->('PAI').


CLASS lcl_app DEFINITION.
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    METHODS pbo.
    METHODS pai.

  PRIVATE SECTION.
    TYPES:
      "! w3mimeappl-appli TYPE c LENGTH 250
      BEGIN OF ty_alv_mimeapp_appli,
        appli_1 TYPE c LENGTH 128,
        appli_2 TYPE c LENGTH 122,
      END OF ty_alv_mimeapp_appli.
    TYPES:
      BEGIN OF ty_alv_mimeapp,
        mtype TYPE w3mimeappl-mtype.
        INCLUDE TYPE ty_alv_mimeapp_appli AS appli.
    TYPES:
      END OF ty_alv_mimeapp.
    TYPES tt_alv_mimeapps TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_alv_mimeapp WITH EMPTY KEY.
    TYPES tt_mimeapps     TYPE TABLE OF w3mimeappl WITH EMPTY KEY.

    CONSTANTS c_mimeappl TYPE w3objid VALUE 'mimeappl'.

    DATA alv_mimeapps TYPE tt_alv_mimeapps.
    DATA grid         TYPE REF TO cl_gui_alv_grid.
    DATA table_spfli  TYPE TABLE OF spfli.

    METHODS get_mimetypes  RETURNING VALUE(et_mimeapps) TYPE tt_mimeapps.
    METHODS save_mimetypes IMPORTING it_mimeapps        TYPE tt_mimeapps.

    METHODS on_onf4
      FOR EVENT onf4 OF cl_gui_alv_grid
      IMPORTING e_fieldname
                es_row_no
                e_fieldvalue
                er_event_data.
ENDCLASS.


CLASS lcl_app IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD pbo.
    IF grid IS BOUND.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.
    SELECT * FROM mimetypes INTO TABLE @DATA(mimetypes).
    DATA(mimeapps) = get_mimetypes( ).
    alv_mimeapps = VALUE #( FOR <mimeapp> IN mimeapps
                            ( mtype   = <mimeapp>-mtype
                              appli_1 = <mimeapp>-appli(128)
                              appli_2 = <mimeapp>-appli+128 ) ).
    LOOP AT mimetypes REFERENCE INTO DATA(mimetype).
      IF NOT line_exists( alv_mimeapps[ mtype = mimetype->type ] ).
        INSERT VALUE #( mtype   = mimetype->type
                        appli_1 = ''
                        appli_2 = '' ) INTO TABLE alv_mimeapps.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    LOOP AT alv_mimeapps REFERENCE INTO DATA(alv_mimeapp)
         WHERE appli NP '!! *'.
      IF NOT line_exists( mimetypes[ type = alv_mimeapp->mtype ] ).
        alv_mimeapp->appli = CONV w3mimeappl-appli( |!! { CONV string( alv_mimeapp->appli ) }| ).
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
    grid = NEW cl_gui_alv_grid( i_parent = cl_gui_container=>screen0 ).
    SET HANDLER on_onf4 FOR grid.
    grid->register_f4_for_fields( it_f4 = VALUE #( register   = abap_true
                                                   chngeafter = abap_true
                                                   ( fieldname  = 'APPLI_1' )
                                                   ( fieldname  = 'APPLI_2' ) ) ).
    DATA(fieldcatalog) = VALUE lvc_t_fcat( ( fieldname = 'MTYPE' ref_table = 'W3MIMEAPPL' ref_field = 'MTYPE' )
                                           ( fieldname  = 'APPLI_1'
                                             dd_outlen  = 128
                                             inttype    = 'C'
                                             lowercase  = abap_true
                                             f4availabl = abap_true
                                             scrtext_l  = 'Editor path (128 first characters)' )
                                           ( fieldname  = 'APPLI_2'
                                             dd_outlen  = 122
                                             inttype    = 'C'
                                             lowercase  = abap_true
                                             f4availabl = abap_true
                                             scrtext_l  = 'Editor path (last characters)' ) ).
    grid->set_table_for_first_display( EXPORTING  is_layout       = VALUE #( edit       = abap_true
                                                                             cwidth_opt = abap_true  )
                                       CHANGING   it_outtab       = alv_mimeapps
                                                  it_fieldcatalog = fieldcatalog
                                       EXCEPTIONS OTHERS          = 4 ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD pai.
    CASE sscrfields-ucomm.
      WHEN 'ONLI'
        OR 'SPOS'.
        grid->check_changed_data( ).
        DATA(mimeapps) = VALUE tt_mimeapps( FOR <alv_mimeapp> IN alv_mimeapps
                                            ( mtype = <alv_mimeapp>-mtype
                                              appli = <alv_mimeapp>-appli ) ).
        save_mimetypes( mimeapps ).
        MESSAGE 'Data saved' TYPE 'I'.
        " Don't trigger save of selection screen variant
        sscrfields-ucomm = ''.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD on_onf4.
    DATA lt_filetable TYPE filetable.
    DATA l_rc         TYPE i.
    DATA l_action     TYPE i.
    DATA return       TYPE TABLE OF ddshretval.

    FIELD-SYMBOLS <ls_file>    TYPE file_table.
    FIELD-SYMBOLS <table_modi> TYPE lvc_t_modi.

    CASE e_fieldname.
      WHEN 'APPLI_1'
        OR 'APPLI_2'.
        DATA(alv_mimeapp) = alv_mimeapps[ es_row_no-row_id ].
        cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog( EXPORTING  default_filename = CONV #( alv_mimeapp-appli )
                                                    CHANGING   file_table       = lt_filetable
                                                               rc               = l_rc
                                                               user_action      = l_action
                                                    EXCEPTIONS OTHERS           = 5 ).
        IF sy-subrc <> 0.
          " TODO error
        ELSEIF l_action <> cl_gui_frontend_services=>action_ok.
          " F4 cancelled by user
        ELSE.
          " 1 file selected
          READ TABLE lt_filetable INDEX 1 ASSIGNING <ls_file>.
          IF sy-subrc = 0.
            DATA(ls_alv_mimeapp) = CONV ty_alv_mimeapp-appli( <ls_file>-filename ).
            ASSIGN er_event_data->m_data->* TO <table_modi>.
            <table_modi> = VALUE #( BASE <table_modi>
                                    row_id = es_row_no-row_id
                                    ( fieldname = 'APPLI_1'
                                      value     = ls_alv_mimeapp-appli_1 )
                                    ( fieldname = 'APPLI_2'
                                      value     = ls_alv_mimeapp-appli_2 ) ).
          ENDIF.
        ENDIF.
        er_event_data->m_event_handled = 'X'.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD get_mimetypes.
    DATA l_objid TYPE wwwdataid.

    CONCATENATE c_mimeappl sy-uname INTO l_objid-objid.
    CLEAR et_mimeapps.
    IMPORT mimeapps = et_mimeapps FROM DATABASE wwwdata(st) ID l_objid.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD save_mimetypes.
    DATA l_objid TYPE wwwdataid.

    CONCATENATE c_mimeappl sy-uname INTO l_objid-objid.
    EXPORT mimeapps = it_mimeapps TO DATABASE wwwdata(st) ID l_objid.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.

entry.title: ACR ‚Äì Business Partner Email Recipient Not Pulled in Statutory Report Distribution
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

Good day!

I‚Äôm currently experiencing an issue in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ‚Äì Advanced Compliance Reporting (ACR) and I‚Äôd like to ask if anyone here has encountered the same.

Issue Description:

When I run statutory reports (e.g., PH_WHT_BIR2307), the Business Partner‚Äôs maintained email address is not being pulled into the To or CC fields of the email recipient setup.

  • The Business Partner master data has the email address properly maintained.

  • However, the statutory reports are not auto populating the email recipients.

  • As a result, the reports are generated but are sent as print output instead of email.

Expected Behavior:

The system should automatically pull the maintained BP email address for the statutory report distribution.

Actual Behavior:

The To/CC fields remain empty, so no email is sent to the intended recipient.

What I‚Äôve Tried So Far (Based on SAP Support‚Äôs Suggestions):

  1. Checked Email ID and Validity:
    I found that the email ID was not maintained for the supplier (e.g., 1000058), and the address usage validity started on 09/10/2025.

    • Because of this, the email wasn‚Äôt available for the reporting task period 07/01/2025 ‚Äì 09/30/2025.

    • I updated the email and validity as suggested in the help portal:
      Enabling E-Mail Recipients and E-Mail Channel for Business Partner Correspondence | SAP Help Portal.

  2. Output Parameter Determination Adjustments:

    • Step: Channel ‚Üí Deleted the marked entry.

    • Step: Email Recipient ‚Üí

      • Deleted the marked entries.

      • Maintained CC and BCC email addresses as direct value inputs.

    • Followed guidance from Output Parameter Determination | SAP Help Portal.

  3. Updated the Receiver Role:
    SAP Support also advised updating the role from BP to T1 for PH_WHT_BIR2307 in the Output Parameter Determination ‚Üí Receiver step.

    • I applied this change and retested.

Current Result:

Despite these adjustments, the issue persists. The report output still goes to Print instead of being sent via email.

My Question:

Has anyone else experienced this issue in ACR where the Business Partner email isn‚Äôt pulled as the recipient for statutory report distribution?
Are there other configuration steps or prerequisites that I might be missing to make the system automatically pull the BP emails?

I‚Äôd really appreciate any insights or recommendations you could share.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: API "Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF" : how to consume in ABAP Cloud ?
entry.content:
The reason for the Internal Error is :

  • Class : CL_HTTP_DESTINATION_PROVIDER
  • Method : create_by_comm_arrangement

There is a local variable declared lv_destination of type rfcdest which is type char32 which is filled in line 260 from the variable logical_port which is type char 60.

LOGICAL_PORT = ZCA_100_7ILD5FN2FYP6BEETPYCZFBT4AY   --> 34 characters ! Will be truncated to 32 characters !

--> lv_Destination : will get a truncated value

entry.title: Re: Clarification on how ‚ÄúLinked Object‚Äù is populated for...
entry.content:
Hi @ludgero_vasconcelos 

What OCN Does and Doesn‚Äôt Send
The OCN completion event payload contains Item ID, Completed Date, Result, duration and optional score.
It does not include Content Object metadata (like Content Object ID, Description, Launch Method, Filename).
This is true for both Skillsoft, LinkedIn Learning, Coursera and other OCN connectors ‚Äî since the completion is posted at the item level.

Implication for OCN
With OCN, completions come via the OCN event feed:
If the learner launched the OCN resource through LMS at least once (meaning the item‚Äôs content object was activated in the LMS content structure), the LMS can attach that object info.


If completion arrives from OCN without any LMS-based launch history, LMS will:
Record the completion at item level
Leave ‚ÄúView Object Details‚Äù empty because there is no content object session binding.


That‚Äôs why for OCN-generated completions you may see item completion without content object details in reports.

Regards 

Harisree CL

entry.title: Re: Reporting on LMS data in Story Reporting
entry.content:
Hi @tduncan 

1. LMS Story Reporting Data Model
When you enable Learning Data in People Analytics, SAP exposes specific logical tables. The key ones for your case:

Table Name (Story Reporting) What it Represents
Item - Course/Curriculum/Component master data. Each record is a learning item.
Item Revision - Versions of learning items. Useful when courses have multiple revisions.
Class - Scheduled offerings for ILT items.
Content Object - SCORM/AICC/TinCan objects inside Items.
Registration - User registrations into items/classes.
Learning History - Completion and transcript records.
User - Learner master data.
Instructor - Instructor profiles.

2. Why You See Duplicate Course Titles

You likely have joins between Learning History and Item without restricting by Item ID or without using the Item Revision dimension, so:
Different items can have the same title (e.g., ‚ÄúSafety Training‚Äù) but different Item IDs in LMS.
Item Title field comes from the Item table ‚Üí Title column
But titles are not guaranteed unique in LMS.
Best practice: Always pull Item ID + Title together if you need to distinguish courses.
Example for Learning History join:
Learning History ‚Üí Item ID
Join Item ‚Üí Item ID ‚Üê This gives you the correct title for the completed item.

Regards 

Harisree CL

entry.title: Int4 Suite ‚Äî your SAP Joule testbed and skills builder
entry.content:
Intro

Want to build reliable Joule skills and agents without breaking anything (or anyone‚Äôs nerves)? Treat Int4 Suite as your Joule testbed and skills builder: a place where you discover the real shape of a skill from historical traffic, scaffold its definition, rehearse end-to-end flows in a safe sandbox, and wire everything into MCP or CI/CD so quality checks can happen automatically.

This post shows a pragmatic playbook for S/4HANA + SAP BTP Integration Suite teams to use Int4 beyond SAP API testing and simulation as a preparation and enablement layer for SAP Business AI.

Why does Int4 belong in your Joule toolchain? 

  • Reality-first inputs. Int4 stores and mines historical electronic messages (IDoc/OData/REST) and master data, gold for grounding AI skills in how your business actually runs.
  • Process-aware, agentic orchestration. It doesn‚Äôt just fire single APIs; it understands and can prepare the business context, chaining SO‚ÜíDelivery‚ÜíInvoice and fixing missing prerequisites on the fly. SAP Community
  • Safe simulation. Int4 Suite virtualizes third-party/partner systems so you can shadow-run agents end-to-end without touching production endpoints.
  • Modern hooks. SAP‚Äôs Joule Studio gives your agents standard tool interfaces; Int4‚Äôs actions and datasets slot right in.

1) Discover the real skill you need (from history)

Problem: Spec sheets rarely match production reality. Which fields are really required? What defaults do users rely on? Which edge cases appear in the wild?

How:

  • Mine historical interface messages across S/4HANA and Integration Suite: pull IDocs, OData/REST payloads for Sales Orders, Deliveries, Invoices, etc. Use them as canonical examples and edge cases for your skill‚Äôs inputs/outputs and constraints.

Figure - Int4 Suite - Robotic Crawler to fetch millions of historical API postings 

  • Reconstruct end-to-end flows (e.g., SO‚ÜíDelivery‚ÜíInvoice) from those messages so your skill spec mirrors the actual business process, not just API docs. This is the core of process-aware agentic testing in Int4. SAP Community

Figure - Int4 Suite - Fix issues with missing stock for a business process posting (outbound delivery part of the Order to Cash process)

Why it matters: You stop guessing which fields matter and start from observed truth, exactly the inputs your Joule skill must handle.

2) Auto-scaffold skill definitions for Joule Studio

Problem: Turning messy real-world payloads into a clean skill I/O schema (and examples) is tedious and easy to get wrong.

How:

  • From mined payloads, extract: required vs. optional fields, typical defaults, allowed value ranges.
  • Turn that into your Joule skill definition (inputs/outputs plus example payloads) in Joule Studio.

Figure - Int4 Suite dimensions created automatically from historical API calls can be used to create Joule skills 

  • Use Int4 Robotic Crawler outputs, hundreds of realistic variants, to seed positive, boundary, and negative examples that harden your prompts/spec.

Why it matters: You get a model-ready spec, grounded in real data, with examples covering the weird cases you‚Äôd otherwise miss.

3) Safe sandboxes for agent rehearsal (‚Äúshadow mode‚Äù)

Problem: Early skills need practice with all their integration touch-points but production endpoints are risky and partners are not always available.

How:

  • Use Int4 Suite to virtualize 3rd-party/partner APIs and even replay historical responses; point your early Joule skill/agent to this sandbox. Run full E2E flows, including error/failure drills, without touching live systems.
  • Pair with SAP S/4 or iFlow stubs so multi-step scenarios can execute safely (e.g., simulate 3PL delivery confirmations, EDI partner messages).

Why it matters: You ‚Äúflight-test‚Äù the skill‚Äôs decisions and error handling in realistic conditions, safely.

4) Wire Int4 Suite into your MCP + CI/CD toolchain

Problem: Skills evolve. APIs and iFlows change. You need automatic quality gates‚Äîevery time.

How:

  • Wrap Int4 actions as MCP tools so your dev copilot or even Joule Studio automations, can call them during build/validation.
  • Let SAP Cloud ALM/DevOps trigger Int4 suites when Joule skills or iFlows change; Int4 already supports automated test-case harvesting and orchestration around Integration Suite.

Why it matters: Every transport becomes self-verifying. Skills can‚Äôt drift out of compliance without getting caught.

How does this complement SAP‚Äôs Business AI?

  • Joule Studio remains where you author skills/agents. Int4 feeds it: schemas, examples, and safe endpoints.
  • MCP servers are how agents call tools; Int4 becomes a tool provider (testing, data seeding, etc.). 
  • Integration Suite + Cloud ALM keep operations clean; Int4 strengthens them with evidence-driven regression around API and iFlow changes.

Figure - Int4 Suite - validate changed APIs or iflows

Where to learn more

  • Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite - why ‚Äúagentic‚Äù tests matter and how Int4 auto-prepares missing context. SAP Community
  • Agentic Testing & Simulation with Int4 Suite‚Äôs SAP Business Knowledge Graph - democratizing simulation & semantic search over test cases. SAP Community
  • Cloud ALM with Integration Suite - monitoring and change-driven automation hooks. SAP Community

entry.title: Re: Learning Notification not received in SF MS Teams chat
entry.content:
Hi @joy2dworld 

1. Why LMS items behave differently

SAP SuccessFactors LMS:
Generates To‚ÄëDos internally for Learning Assignments and Approvals.

These To‚ÄëDos are visible in the SF "To‚ÄëDo List" widget because the Platform UI queries LMS via an internal learning microservice.
However, Teams notifications are driven by the Work Tech Integration To‚ÄëDo APIs and Intelligent Services events.

By default:

LMS learning assignments are not included in the Work Tech-supported To‚ÄëDo API feed unless you enable Learning in Unified To‚ÄëDo Feed.
Many LMS-generated tasks also don‚Äôt appear in the Home Page Tiles unless "New Home Page" is enabled and Learning is configured to push those tasks via the To‚ÄëDo framework.

2. Extra Setup Needed

A. Enable LMS in the Unified To‚ÄëDo Framework
In Admin Center ‚Üí Manage To‚ÄëDo Alerts and Notifications:
Check for Learning task types and ensure they are enabled for cards.
For some customers, SAP must enable the Learning To‚ÄëDos in To‚ÄëDo Service via a backend toggle ‚Äî you may need to raise a Support ticket.
SAP KB: 3004742 ‚Äî Learning To‚ÄëDos not appearing in People Profile or Work Tech cards.

B. Intelligent Services Event Subscription
The Work Tech integration listens for Intelligent Services events (ISE) such as:
Learning Item Assigned
Learning Item Pending Approval
Learning Completion Recorded
Check in Admin Center ‚Üí Intelligent Services Center:
Locate events under ‚ÄúSAP Learning‚Äù category.
Subscribe them to the Microsoft Teams channel that Work Tech uses.
For Approvals, check ‚ÄúLearning Request Requires Approval‚Äù event.
Note: Not all Learning events are enabled for Work Tech out of the box ‚Äî some require that you have Learning Approval Service active via OData.

C. LMS OData & To‚ÄëDo API Exposure
Learning cards in Teams and SF Home Page cards pull from To‚ÄëDo API (/odata/v4/Todo):
In Provisioning ‚Üí Enable SAP SuccessFactors Learning for To‚ÄëDo Integration.
This ensures Learning To‚ÄëDo objects (e.g., LearningAssignment, LearningApproval) are exposed to the unified card generator.
For integrated tenants, this is managed via BizX‚ÄìLMS integration settings in Provisioning:

Enable new Learning Home Page Tiles
Enable Learning To-Do Integration
Enable Learning Filter in To-Do service

These three toggles must be ON.

D. Home Page Tile/Card behaviour
Old homepage: Learning assignments appear only in To‚ÄëDo list, not as tiles.
New home page framework (2021 onwards): Requires you to activate Learning Tiles in Configure Home Page and map them to the unified To‚ÄëDo service.
Path: Admin Center ‚Üí Configure Home Page ‚Üí Add Card ‚Üí Select ‚ÄúLearning ‚Äî Required Learning‚Äù or ‚ÄúLearning ‚Äî Approvals‚Äù.

3. Key Points
Work Tech cards for Teams rely on Unified To‚ÄëDo feed + Intelligent Services events.
LMS assignments & approvals will not show unless Learning To‚ÄëDo integration is configured and backend toggles enabled.
You may need SAP Support to confirm your tenant has Learning tasks mapped to the To‚ÄëDo framework.
The Employee To‚ÄëDo list is richer and can display LMS items even if they‚Äôre not available as Teams cards ‚Äî because it directly queries LMS via internal API.

4. Recommended Action Plan
Check To‚ÄëDo configuration: Admin Center ‚Üí Manage To‚ÄëDo Alerts and Notifications ‚Üí Verify Learning tasks are enabled.
Verify Intelligent Services events: Admin Center ‚Üí Intelligent Services Center ‚Üí Search "Learning".
Check Provisioning toggles (requires partner/SAP access):
Enable Learning in Unified To‚ÄëDo feed.
Enable new Learning Home Page Tiles.
Add Learning cards to SF Home Page via Configure Home Page.
If LMS tasks still don‚Äôt appear in Teams, raise SAP Support Ticket requesting enablement of Learning To‚ÄëDo API entities for Work Tech integration.

Regards 

Harisree CL

entry.title: The strength of a community can be seen in events like SAP Inside Track Porto 2025
entry.content:
This past weekend I had the privilege of once again taking part in SAP Inside Track Porto 2025, held at the inspiring Hotel Forte de Gaia. It was a very special event, not only because of the unique atmosphere and the energy of the SAP community, but also because I had the honor of contributing in two ways: as an organizer and as a speaker.

The SAP community in Portugal keeps surprising me with the quality of knowledge shared and the spirit of collaboration that grows stronger each year. This year‚Äôs agenda struck a great balance between highly technical topics ‚Äî such as innovation with CAP and AI Agents ‚Äî and hands-on experiences in S/4HANA projects and SAP Cloud ERP. Each session was an opportunity to learn something new and exchange insights with colleagues and friends who, like me, believe that the real strength of the community lies in sharing real-world experiences.

In my session, I spoke about bank connectivity in SAP, presenting a project we delivered in partnership with MAKEVALUE and SIBS LABS. I demonstrated how APIs and direct integrations can simplify critical financial processes: from payments and collections to bank statements, Open Finance, and instant payments. It was very rewarding to share the results and see the audience‚Äôs interest in exploring these scenarios, which are increasingly becoming part of companies‚Äô daily operations.

The event closed on a memorable note with live music, reminding us that technology and culture can ‚Äî and should ‚Äî walk hand in hand.

I left this SIT Porto 2025 with a strong sense of accomplishment, but also with renewed inspiration to keep investing in this community that grows year after year. A special thank you to all the speakers, participants, and colleagues who made this gathering possible.

And, as tradition, the positive balance of the event will be donated to a social support institution, reinforcing the idea that the SAP community is not only about technology but also about making a positive impact on society.

See you at the next SIT!

entry.title: Re: Display of Opening Movement from balance carryforward...
entry.content:
Hello @BlasRosello4 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, balance carryforward records open with opening balances in Period 000 of ACDOCA without generating an FI document. Since AR_JOURNAL_LEDGER is document-based, these Period-0 balances won‚Äôt show up in the Libro Diario. It‚Äôs intentional, S4HANA Public Cloud  

Here are some ways customers typically manage this in practice:

Try posting a legal opening journal on Day 1 (Period 001) to create a real FI document that flows into AR_JOURNAL_LEDGER. Use the Post Opening Balances / Schedule Post Closing and Opening Balances features, as auditors often find this helpful.  SAP Help Portal-Post Opening Balances

If your auditor agrees, consider adding an opening line through a DRC manual adjustment. This way, the statutory extract will show the opening movement, and the Period-0 carryforward remains unchanged. To do this, simply configure and run the Journal Ledger ‚Äì Argentina report in DRC. SAP Help Portal-Setting Up the Journal Ledger

There is no default switch to set AR_JOURNAL_LEDGER to read Period-0 carryforward automatically. To ensure full compliance with Libro Diario, it's best to post an opening journal entry as recommended. If that's not possible, a DRC manual adjustment with an auditor‚Äôs sign-off can be used as an alternative.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: reset password for S User
entry.content:
Hi Marija,

To help the user set their initial password, please follow the steps outlined below using Forgot Password link detailed in KBA 1808560:

1. Go to Forgot My Password

2. Enter S-user ID S00xxxxxxxx 

3. Click Continue

4.An email will be sent from SAP ID Service (ias@notifications.sap.com) to the email address registered for the user.

5. Locate the email and use the password reset link provided.

  • Password reset link is valid for 2 hours from the time it was generated from the system, and can only be used once. If the password reset link expires before you reset the password, repeat the steps above.
  • If no e-mail is received from ias@notifications.sap.com, make sure the S-user's e-mail address is valid and that it isn't being routed to the user's spam/junk e-mail folder. If no e-mail is found, send an e-mail to SAP ID Service directly at: sso@sap.com

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions. 

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Enterprise Service Management in Action: AI-Driven Service Experiences at SAP Connect 2025
entry.content:
Enterprise Service Management at SAP Connect 2025

SAP Connect is about more than bringing people together ‚Äî it‚Äôs about uniting ideas, innovation, and technology to shape the future of work. This year, SAP SuccessFactors Enterprise Service Management takes the spotlight, showcasing how organizations can deliver seamless, AI-driven service experiences across HR and beyond.

From inspiring keynotes to roadmap deep dives, demos, and customer stories, you will see how SAP is helping businesses:

  • Empower employees with intuitive, guided self-service
  • Boost HR efficiency through intelligent automation
  • Increase agility and scalability with data-driven insights
  • Extend service delivery into finance, procurement, and more
  • Integrate AI into everyday interactions to make services smarter and faster

Whether you are exploring the latest innovations, seeking practical strategies, or learning from customer journeys, there‚Äôs an Enterprise Service Management session designed for you.

Enterprise Service Management Highlights at SAP Connect

HCM Keynote: Unprecedented Possibilities ‚Äî Connecting Your People and Your Business

October 7 | 8:30 ‚Äì 9:30 AM
Watch Dan Beck demo ESM in action and highlight innovations that redefine HR service delivery with AI, simplicity, and efficiency.

While ESM is transforming HR service delivery, SAP Connect also showcases how service innovation extends across the business:
